events.description:
Join HEC Seed, the biggest seed-stage startup event organized for the Startup scene in France and outside by HEC Paris students! We are a conference with the mission to foster interest around entrepreneurship and accelerate innovative projects within the HEC and Station F community.

We connect and empower young entrepreneurs, students, investors and other professionals through a dynamic mix of activities encompassing the following:

- Pitch competitions: we are featuring 10 startups selected out of 60 applicants through two competitions with up to 5,000‚Ç¨ in prize money

- Panels: we have two panels in AI and Fintech, featuring entrepreneurs and industry experts as speakers

- Networking: the entire event will be organized to facilitate networking, culminating in a cocktail for all participants, speakers and jury members

The event will take place on June 6th, 2018 at Station F in Paris.

slots.description: Registration at the front door with an introduction of event & MC's on the Master Stage.
slots.title: Registration & Welcome

slots.description:
Speakers to be announced

Panel discussing practical case studies with entrepreneurs, large corporations and other experts in the machine learning domain.

speakers.bio:
In 1999, Fred Potter created CIRPACK, a telecommunications supplier, later bought by TECHNICOLOR; and WITHINGS, sold to NOKIA, before creating NETATMO in 2011.
His vision: a company where every employee knows how the business and projects grow and where daily life is driven by a strong sense of innovation, empowerment, hard work and sharing.
speakers.name: Fred  Potter

speakers.bio: Since september 2016, Erwan Sconet is an assistant professor at the Center for Applied Mathematics (CMAP) in Ecole Polytechnique near Paris. His researches interests focus on theoretical statistics and Machine Learning with a particular emphasis on nonparametric estimates. He has done a PhD thesis on a particular algorithm of Machine Learning called random forests, under the supervision of G√©rard Biau (LSTA - Paris 6) and Jean-Philipe Vert (Institut Curie).
speakers.name: Erwan Scornet

slots.title: Can AI help startups develop a competitive advantage in today‚Äôs business environment?

slots.description:
What could perfectly complement the great FinTech panel than some insights on an emmerging way to finance entrepreneurship: Initial Coin Offering leveraging the blockchain technology.

Several great successes have happened over the past few months. It now looks clear that ICO is a robust way to seek for funds.

However the subject is still subject to polemics and the intent of this panel is to discuss the risks and limitations of ICO and their regulation.

speakers.bio: S√©bastien Bourguignon is Principal & Lead Digital Influencer at Margo and is an expert in digital and blockchain technology. He advises his clients in their digital transformation and their projects of ICO or blockchain. Passionate about digital, innovation and startups, he has also created a blog to share news on these topics. He created the project #PortraitDeStartuper in which he involves startupers to present their return of experience in their entrepreneurial adventure.
speakers.name: S√©bastien Bourguignon

speakers.bio: Conquer the future through BlockChain. @DomRaider is the bridge between the world of assets and the potential of #blockchain. Follow also @Auctionity @YoudotApp
speakers.name: Tristan Colombet

slots.title: Regulating #ICO: a walk through case studies, risks and upcoming regulation on this new way to finance entrepreneurship

slots.description:
5 selected startups pitch for up to 5,000‚Ç¨ prize money.

Startups will pitch 5 minutes presentation plus 3 minutes Q&A in front of our jury composed of entrepreneurs and investors. The competition is sector agnostic with startups at various stages (love money, pre-seed, seed), which we'll segregate into two competitions to ensure fair competition.
slots.title: Pitch Competition - Pre-Seed

slots.description: Panel discussing the role of disruptive fintech services and their relationship to traditional banks.

speakers.bio:
Olivier Godement leads startups operations and development in France and Southern Europe for Stripe, a technology company that builds economic infrastructure for the internet. Before joining Stripe in 2014, he created SparkUp, one of France's first business crowdfunding platforms. Olivier is a graduate of SciencesPo and ESSEC.

Olivier will be a speaking in the fintech panel.
speakers.name: Olivier Godement

speakers.bio:
Alexandre Prot (HEC Paris and INSEAD graduate) is a serial entrepreneur and angel investor in Internet of Things (IoT), fintech and SaaS companies. While overseeing financial tasks at Smokio, he had been tremendously frustrated by his banking experience. That‚Äôs why he decided to launch Qonto: the banking alternative for entrepreneurs and startups. Qonto raised a seed round of ‚Ç¨1.6m  in 2016.

Alexandre will be speaking in the fintech panel.
speakers.name: Alexandre Prot

speakers.bio:
Olivier founded 123Investment Managers in 2000 with the desire to democratize access to private equity by opening the asset class to retail investors. 123Investment Managers now has over 70,000 private clients and 1.3 billion euros of assets under management invested in 108 European non-listed companies. Olivier was the CEO of 123Investment Managers until September 2014 and is now Chairman of the Supervisory Board.

Olivier will be speaking in the fintech panel.
speakers.name: Olivier Goy

speakers.bio:
Claire Calmejane joined Lloyds Banking Group in October 2012, serving 28 million customers, where she is currently Director of Innovation and Digital Center of Excellence. She was instrumental in building LBG innovation function and digital people strategy. Prior to joining LBG, Claire has spent 7 years in management consulting. She also led the founding phase of a research program on digital transformation at MIT, Cambridge.

Claire will be speaking in the fintech panel.
speakers.name: Claire Calmejane

speakers.bio:
J√©r√©mie Rosselli is General Manager France at N26 Group.

J√©r√©mie will be speaking in the fintech panel.
speakers.name: Jeremie Rosselli

speakers.bio:
Olivier Bossard is the Executive Director of the flagship MSc Finance program at HEC Paris. Prior to his 25 years career in Capital Markets across Paris, London and Frankfurt, Olivier earned an Engineering Degree from Ecole Centrale Paris, with Applied Maths specialization, complemented by a MSc in Maths & Artificial Intelligence (with Cryptography and Neural Networks specialization) from Yokohama National University in Japan.

Olivier will be moderating the fintech panel.
speakers.name: Olivier Bossard

slots.title: FinTech & Banks: Friends or Foe?

slots.description:
5 selected startups pitch for up to 5,000‚Ç¨ prize money.

Startups will pitch 5 minutes presentation plus 3 minutes Q&A in front of our jury composed of entrepreneurs and investors. The competition is sector agnostic with startups at various stages (love money, pre-seed, seed), which we'll segregate into two competitions to ensure fair competition.
slots.title: Pitch Competition - Seed Stage

slots.description:
HEC Innovation was launched to support HEC early-stage entrepreneurs. Alumni from Silicon Valley got together to launch this and offer a financial prize as well as mentorship from top entrepreneurs and executives of Silicon Valley. 
We are proud to include this prize into HEC Seed event, aligned with the mission of supporting early stage entrepreneurs and the HEC community.
HEC Innovation will award 25,000‚Ç¨ money prizes to startups which are pre-selected based on an independent judging process. The selected teams will be given a chance to pitch their startups on the HEC Seed stage.
slots.title: HEC Innovation Awards Ceremony

slots.description: A total of 5,000‚Ç¨ from the HEC Entrepreneurship Center and a Stripe premium package will be awarded to the winners of the two pitch competitions. The exact division of the prize money is TBD based on the stage of startups shortlisted and the industry in which they operate.
slots.title: HEC Seed Awards Ceremony

slots.description: Networking and fun during the closing cocktail.
slots.title: Cocktail

speakers.bio: Alexis Robert spent four years as an entrepreneur, as the cofounder & CTO of ShowMango, a subscription platform for events in London, and PayinTech (previously known as MyBee), a fintech startup in Paris. He joined Kima Venture in Paris and works to identify and evaluate new investments and to build and improve internal software tools.
speakers.name: Alexis Robert

speakers.bio:
Philosophical VC in Paris. Global nomad. Did NOT co-found Yahoo! in 1994. General Partner @ Hardware Club.

Check out his blog "THE CONSCIENCE OF A VC IN PARIS" @ http://www.jmyang.com/
speakers.name: Jerry Yang

speakers.bio: Jean runs Kima Ventures, the venture capital of french billionaire Xavier Niel. They invest in 100 new startups per year all over the world and count 650 companies in their portfolio. He serves at the board of Zenly, Payfit, Side, Ibanfirst, Forest Admin and Sourced.
speakers.name: Jean de La Rochebrochard

speakers.bio: Lucas works in the seed team at Partech and is in charge of meeting and reaching out to outstanding entrepreneurs all around Europe. Prior to Partech, Lucas was an analyst at Kerala Ventures and also worked in the marketing teams at Tiller Systems, Microsoft and Deezer.
speakers.name: Lucas Liabeuf

speakers.bio: VC @ ParTech
speakers.name: Alison Imbert

speakers.bio:
Lucie Vannier is a Customer Engineer in Google Cloud France, responsible of the Gaming & Entertainment market assisting companies in their digital transition.
She started at IBM as a technical advisor / pre-sales architect in the banking industry. Passionate about technology and innovation, she do also loves FoodCh√©ri, cats and climbing (despite an evident lack of talent in this area).
speakers.name: Lucie Vannier

partner.description:
The world‚Äôs rendezvous for startups & leaders, on May 24th - 26th 2018, Paris.

VivaTech is the world's rendezvous for startups and leaders to celebrate innovation together. It's a gathering of the world's brightest minds, talents, and products taking place in Paris on 24‚Äì26 May 2018.
partner.name: VIVA Technology

partner.description: HEC Paris has been committed to entrepreneurship, innovation and inclusive business, both in terms of training and research, for over 30 years. We actively encourage innovative and responsible business initiatives. This approach is supported by the Entrepreneurship Center which promotes business creation.
partner.name: HEC Entrepreneurship Center
